column1: 1 ^ Laŭdáte Dòminum de caĕlîs~; laŭdáte eum in excèlsîs. ^ Praise ye the Lord from the heavens~; praise ye him in the high places.

column3: òmnes virtútes ejus. ^ Praise ye him all his angels~; praise ye him all his hosts.
òmnes stellaĕ et lumen. ^ Praise ye him
column4: O sun and moon~; praise him

column3: et aqŭa qŭaĕ super caĕlos sunt. ^ Praise him
column5: and thou water that art above the heavens.

column1: 5 ^ Laŭdent nomen Dòmini~; qŭia ìpse dixit
column3: et creáta sunt. ^ Let them praise the name of the Lord~; for he spoke
column4: and they were made~; he commanded

column2: et in sáĕculum sáĕculi~; praĕcèptum pósuit
column3: et non praĕteríbit. ^ He hath established them for ever
column4: and for ages of ages~; he hath made a decree
column5: and it shall not pass away.

column3: ^ Praise the Lord from the earth
column4: ye dragons and all ye deeps

column3: ^ kings of the earth and all people
column4: princes and all judges of the earth

column2: qŭia exaltátum est nomen ejus sólius~; confèssio ejus super caĕlum et terram. ^ let them praise the name of the Lord
column3: for exalted is the name of him alone~; the praise of him is above heaven and earth.

column1: 14 ^ Et exaltávit cornu pòpuli sui~; hìmnus òmnibus sanctîs ejus
column3: pòpulo appropinqŭánti sìbi. ^ And he hath exalted the horn of his people~; a hymn to all his saints
column5: to a people drawing nigh unto him.
